derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English flicce, originally denoting the salted and cured side of any meat, of Germanic origin; related to Middle Low German vlicke

means.word_mean: 1. fish steak usually cut from a halibut
2. salted and cured abdominal wall of a side of pork
